Uses of Class
alston.minecraft.Item

    • Uses of Item in alston.minecraft

      Subclasses of Item in alston.minecraft 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  BlockItem
      An extension the abstract class Item, and is for any Items that will become a block when right clicked.
      class  EmptyItem
      Represents an empty/no Item or slot (Null Object Pattern).
      class  SimpleItem
      Objects of this class represents Items that have no special features, and do not become Blocks.
      class  Tool
      Contains both the Item aspect of tools and the Spatials for a 3D representation.
      class  TorchItem
      An Item that will have a special Spatial and physics Control (is NOT a Block-shaped item).
      Fields in alston.minecraft declared as Item 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Item[] Item.ITEMS
      Prototype of every Item in the game.
      Methods in alston.minecraft that return Item 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Item Item.clone() 
      Item Window.getClickedItem() 
      Item[][] SlotArea.getItems() 
      Methods in alston.minecraft with parameters of type Item 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean SlotArea.add(Item item)
      Adds a given item to the slotArea.
      void InventoryBar.attach(Item item)
      Attaches the given Item to the given slot
      void SlotArea.defaultPlace(Item item, int x, int y)
      Common operations called for place(); used instead of a super-call in the case that a SlotArea would no need this.
      void InventoryBar.detach(Item item)
      Detaches the given Item from the bar
      abstract void SlotArea.place(Item item, int x, int y)
      Places the given Item in the given slot coordinates, whether or not it is currently occupied.
      void Window.setClickedItem(Item clickedItem)
